history.content: In my opinion, 162 and 170 are the most foundational upper division classes and would be possible taken together given that your other classes are non technical. In your case, I would definitely not take 169 or 160 as they can both be picked up in the industry relative to most other CS upper divs. It also depends on your interests, I absolutely loved 186 and 189 (if you're into data science). I would definitely recommend fitting in 162, 170, 186, and 189 if you can, but if that's too ambitious, then I would exclude 186 as there exists overlap with 162 and it's the most optional in my opinion. 162, 170, and 189 are all huge time commitments by the way. Not sure if this was the thorough answer you were seeking, but feel free to post a follow up :)

I would definitely recommend fitting in 162, 170, 186, and 189 if you can, but if that's too ambitious, then I would exclude 186 as there exists overlap with 162 and it's the most optional in my opinion. 162, 170, and 189 are all huge time commitments by the way. Not sure if this was the thorough answer you were seeking, but feel free to post a follow up :)

This is going to be a long post, so be warned. 

I am currently fourth year cognitive science major cs minor (next year will be my fourth year). I have the 61 series along with 70, 188, and, math 53 and 54. 

I want to go into some sort of computer science field, though I am not entirely sure which one. Machine learning is a field which I am interested in, though my only exposure to it being from the latter part of 188, I enjoy it so far, but haven't been exposed to it enough to conclude it is something I enjoy more than other aspects of computer science. 

My original plan was to take cs 189 and cs 186, then cs 169 and cs 160. However, this means I would not be taking cs 162, and cs 170, which I have heard are very important. 168 also seems rather interesting. 

Thus, what are some classes that would be the most beneficial for me to take, and which ones would be doable to be taken in the same semester?

Is 162 and 170 doable in a semester when taken with other non-technicals, and is the material from cs 169 and cs 160 able to be learned on my own, allowing me to take other classes? Should I wait on cs 189, and take machine learning classes in grad school as to take other classes to give me a more solid foundation in the field of computer science? Is cs 186 not particularly useful if you take 162 instead?

Part of the difficulty is that I am not entirely sure what specific field I want to pursue, so I just want to take classes to help me in whatever field I end up wanting to pursue. Any advice, personal experiences, warnings are all appreciated. Thank you.
history.subject: Important Upper Division Classes
